Package hu.bme.mit.theta.xcfa.analysis.portfolio.common

Class AbstractPortfolio

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.bme.mit.theta.xcfa.analysis.portfolio.common.AbstractPortfolio
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComplexPortfolio, SequentialPortfolio
    public abstract class AbstractPortfolio
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class of portfolio classes executeConfiguration(CegarConfiguration, XCFA, long) is already implemented and can/should be used by subclasses executeAnalysis(hu.bme.mit.theta.xcfa.model.XCFA, java.time.Duration) is not implemented and should be the "main" method in the subclasses (concrete portfolios) Uses 2 threads when executing analysis Uses thread.stop() if analysis times out - use at your own risk

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract SafetyResult<?,​?> executeAnalysis​(XCFA xcfa, java.time.Duration initializationTime)
      Not implemented by the base class, should be used as the main method for concrete portfolios
      protected Tuple2<Result,​java.util.Optional<SafetyResult<?,​?>>> executeConfiguration​(CegarConfiguration configuration, XCFA xcfa, long timeout)
      The main reason this class exists - all subclasses should use this method to execute their given configurations Handles solver lifecycles, threads, etc.
      void outputResultFiles​(SafetyResult<?,​?> status, java.lang.String refinementSolver)
      Creates and saves the counterexample into a file, also saves statistics into files (implemented by OutputHandler )

    • Method Detail

      • executeAnalysis

        public abstract SafetyResult<?,​?> executeAnalysis​(XCFA xcfa,
                                                        java.time.Duration initializationTime)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Not implemented by the base class, should be used as the main method for concrete portfolios
        Parameters:
        xcfa - the model to execute the portfolio on
        initializationTime - how long the model transformation and optimization took (can be subtracted from the global time limit to get the time limit for the analysis)
        Returns:
        the result of the analysis
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • outputResultFiles

        public void outputResultFiles​(SafetyResult<?,​?> status,
                              java.lang.String refinementSolver)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates and saves the counterexample into a file, also saves statistics into files (implemented by OutputHandler )
        Parameters:
        status - result of the given configuration
        refinementSolver - the solver to be used to generate a counterexample
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - most likely solver exception

      • executeConfiguration

        protected Tuple2<Result,​java.util.Optional<SafetyResult<?,​?>>> executeConfiguration​(CegarConfiguration configuration,
                                                                                                XCFA xcfa,
                                                                                                long timeout)
        The main reason this class exists - all subclasses should use this method to execute their given configurations Handles solver lifecycles, threads, etc. Uses 2 threads when executing analysis Uses thread.stop() if analysis times out - use at your own risk
        Parameters:
        configuration - the configuration to execute
        xcfa - the model to execute the analysis on
        timeout - in ms
        Returns:
        the result of the analysis
